title.narrative: Haweenka - Women of Somalia participating in decision making and peacebuilding

description.narrative: Women in Somalia are generally excluded from the decision making processes both at national and local level. This undermines women's rights and has many negative consequences to their lives in general. The objective of the project is to provide local women of Southwestern Somalia with good understanding of women's rights and skills to influence and participate decision making as well as peace promotion. To support this the project seeks to evoke public discussion about women's role and participation in deci sion making and peacebuilding. The project also aims at supporting cooperation and organization between women. The focus of the project is on the work done locally as the local reality has the biggest effects to women's everyday lives. In the long run the project aims at increasing gender equality and democracy in Somalia. Out of the women who participate the trainings during the pilot project in 2014 15 will be chosen to start working as focal points in the continuation project in 5 towns. 15 more focal po ints will be trained in 2016 to cover 5 more towns. The focal points will be responsible for forming local women's groups in these 10 towns and train them about women's rights and women's participation in decision making and peace promotion. The next step is that the local women's groups with the help of the focal point start to carry out local activities which include meetings with the local authorities the elders and religious leaders local events on women's participation in decision making and peacebuil ding Vote for a woman! -campaign before federal elections 2016 and collecting and producing information for the web page of the project and other advocacy purposes. In 2017 the focal points and representatives of local women's organizations will gather to a sum-up seminar to share the experiences from different towns with each other and map the ways forward. The project will also contribute to the partner organization BWDO's (Banadir Women's Development Organization) capacity to promote women's rights and p articipation in decision making and peacebuilding.
